glsa.title: FFmpeg: Buffer overflows
glsa.synopsis: FFmpeg is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows that might be exploited to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: FFmpeg is a very fast video and audio converter.

description.p: FFmpeg contains buffer overflows in the AVI processing code.

impact.p: An attacker could trigger the buffer overflows by enticing a user to load a specially crafted AVI file in an application using the FFmpeg library. This might result in the execution of arbitrary code in the context of the running application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All FFmpeg users should upgrade to the latest version:
